Hello there We have read the situation


In most cases when using Hotmail/Outlook domains within Thunderbird, there will be no notification from the program to enable or disable certain topics for better use. In this case, place a copy of the sent message in the sent folder again. The issue that IMAP users having mostly.

Having or getting these providers together it might that there is a another (double)copie of the message in that sended folder again. Account settings > copies and folders and change it to not save a copy there . That could change the complete situation.

content: This is an IMAP account. Example: I make a filter on my laptop that works fine. But when I look at the desktop the filter is not there. When I make a filter on the desktop it works. But when I look at the laptop the filter is not there. I expect the same filters on both my laptop and on the desktop.
creator: mario98

content:
mario98 said
I expect the same filters on both my laptop and on the desktop.

Filters are not synchronized between computers - that is not part of any standard specification.

If you are using filters in an automatic mode only, there is no reason to have them on more than one system - in fact it is best not.
creator: wsmwk

content: You can manually copy filters between computers, but to sync them it's probably easier to define the filters in webmail settings so they are device-independent.

content:
Non vedo cosa c'entri Thunderbird... Mi spiego meglio: - quando invii la posta da Thunderbird, questa parte con il tuo indirizzo IP - quando la invii da webmail parte con l'IP del server

Per cui potrebbe essere il tuo IP ad essere nelle blacklist. Tuttavia dici anche di aver usato un altro client, di quale si tratta? È possibile anche se improbabile che la classificazione come spam nasca dalla combinazione tra il tuo IP e le intestazioni di Thunderbird. Ma si tratta appunto di capire perché l'altro client non viene bloccato.

Inoltre, Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
pbj116 said
Recycle bin only stores deleted emails for about a month, never emptied the recycle bin myself, but there are only deleted emails from a month ago

Many mail providers automatically delete Trash mail older than 30 days. To avoid this, create a new folder and have deleted mail moved there (Account Settings/Server Settings).

Oh, that looks like bad user interface design. I had not noticed it before.

I'm not an expert, and I don't guarantee anything, but one way around that bad design might be to use the configuration editor (Thunderbird settings - General - Config editor). Just a guess. Maybe someone else can confirm that this approach will do what you want safely.

content:
Several things seem to be going on here.

  1. There have been problems with notifications lately. People are working on them. Let's hope for improvements.
  2. You seem to have tried to respond to David's post by replying to the e-mail notification. That doesn't work. Click on "Post a reply" in the e-mail message.
  3. You seem to be trying to open a disk image that was sent to you as an e-mail attachment, without first saving it on your drive. If it is the right disk image for your computer, try saving it to your drive, closing Thunderbird, and then opening the disk image. If you are not already using version 136.0, I would first try updating Thunderbird from Thunderbird settings - General. If you are not sure that the disk image that you have is the right one, go to https://www.thunderbird.net and download the program.
creator: mozilla98

content: That was once easy, but now email providers compare the sending email address with the SMTP server's email address. I respect what you want to do, but it's called spoofing - pretending to be who you are not, a technique used by spammers and hackers. My suggestion is to speak to your company's tech support to see if you can get company email at home, as that will address the issue. If I am misunderstanding, please reply. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
"Certificate Manager can't locate a valid certificate that can be used to digitally sign your messages"

Is there any more information in the Error Console when you attempt to sign messages? Press Ctrl-Shift-J to bring up the Error Console.

</blockquote> ... the Basic Constraints section shows "Certificate Authority: No" </blockquote>

If this is for your personal cert, then it obviously isn't a CA cert, so "No" is correct.

content:
I thought I remembered something from the dim past about yahoo. It was this. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1435903

Is the same outgoing server in use?

Perhaps try the workaround mentioned in the bug. It can not hurt. I sort of recall that some German mail servers will try and enforce windows code pages which is a no no with UTF, but some companies are slow to adapt. So one of the first things is to ensure the server is working how it should. Hence my question of is the SMTP server the same as the ones that are Ok.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
HI Matt,

thanks for your reply. It seems it is an issue with Thunderbird for Windows only. I've sent a test message with Thunderbird for Android. This worked as expected. And the answer to your question if the SMTP server is the same as the ones that are ok, the answer is no. It is a different one. I wanted to try to the suggested setting for work-around no. 1, however it is not possible to set this anymore in Thunderbird. I cannot find the menus Display or the Format tab in Thunderbird 128.8.0esr. How do I find these settings now? All I can do is to set "mail.strictly_mime" to true. After I did that mails have now a CTE base64. I wanted it to be quoted-printable. So I'm a bit puzzled because I couldn't find the menu structure mentioned for the work-around. Do you have an idea? I should not forgot to mention that these are postfix 3.8.6 servers which are advertising "8BITMIME" support. These are my own servers.
